Based on the available follow‐up through age 69.3 showing no progression on serial imaging, the early stage (IIA/2B) at diagnosis, and typical post‐treatment survival statistics for resected lung adenocarcinoma in this stage, it is highly likely the patient will remain alive over the next 18 months.  
[ANSWER: A) Yes]
